com.noctarius.tengi.core.serialization.codec

Interface Decoder

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    AutoClosableDecoder, Codec

    public interface Decoder
    The Decoder interface defines the decoding part of the Codec contract. It provides a set of read-methods to transform a byte-stream into values. The internal implementation of the wire-protocol byte-stream depends on the chosen Codec and Protocol implementation and serialization and deserialization should not depend on implementation details.

    • Method Detail

      • readBytes

        void readBytes(byte[] bytes)

        Transfers the content of a byte-array from the underlying byte-stream buffer. The byte-array is read as a whole from begin to the end.

        If the underlying buffer is to small to read all of the content, an IndexOutOfBoundsException is thrown.

        Parameters:
        bytes - the byte-array to transfer the content to
        Throws:
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - whenever the buffer is too small to read all elements

      • readBytes

        void readBytes(byte[] bytes,
               int offset,
               int length)

        Transfers the content of a byte-array from the underlying byte-stream buffer. The byte-array is read as a whole beginning from the given offset and will be filled with as many bytes as defined by the given length.

        If the underlying buffer is to small to read all of the content, an IndexOutOfBoundsException is thrown.

        Parameters:
        bytes - the byte-array to transfer the content to
        offset - the offset to begin to write to
        length - the number of bytes to write
        Throws:
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - whenever the buffer is too small to read all elements

      • readBoolean

        boolean readBoolean()

        Reads the content of a boolean from the underlying byte-stream buffer.

        If the underlying buffer is to small to read all of the content, an IndexOutOfBoundsException is thrown.

        Returns:
        the boolean value read from the buffer
        Throws:
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - whenever the buffer is too small to read all elements

      • readBitSet

        boolean[] readBitSet()

        Reads the content of a boolean-array (or bitSet) from the underlying byte-stream buffer. A bitSet is always read as a whole but the Encoder implementation was free to compact or compress the values before writing, just as the default implementation does. Therefore the wire-protocol depends on the chosen Codec implementation.

        If the underlying buffer is to small to read all of the content, an IndexOutOfBoundsException is thrown.

        Returns:
        the boolean-array (or bitSet) value read from the buffer
        Throws:
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - whenever the buffer is too small to read all elements

      • readByte

        byte readByte()

        Reads the content of a byte from the underlying byte-stream buffer.

        If the underlying buffer is to small to read all of the content, an IndexOutOfBoundsException is thrown.

        Returns:
        the byte value read from the buffer
        Throws:
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - whenever the buffer is too small to read all elements

      • readUnsignedByte

        short readUnsignedByte()

        Reads the content of an unsigned byte from the underlying byte-stream buffer. It was up to the Encoder implementation how to write the value to the buffer. Therefore the wire-protocol depends on the chosen Codec implementation.

        If the underlying buffer is to small to read all of the content, an IndexOutOfBoundsException is thrown.

        Returns:
        the unsigned byte value read from the buffer
        Throws:
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - whenever the buffer is too small to read all elements

      • readShort

        short readShort()

        Reads the content of a short from the underlying byte-stream buffer.

        If the underlying buffer is to small to read all of the content, an IndexOutOfBoundsException is thrown.

        Returns:
        the short value read from the buffer
        Throws:
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - whenever the buffer is too small to read all elements

      • readChar

        char readChar()

        Reads the content of a char from the underlying byte-stream buffer.

        If the underlying buffer is to small to read all of the content, an IndexOutOfBoundsException is thrown.

        Returns:
        the char value read from the buffer
        Throws:
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - whenever the buffer is too small to read all elements

      • readInt32

        int readInt32()

        Reads the content of an int value with 32 bits from the underlying byte-stream buffer.

        If the underlying buffer is to small to read all of the content, an IndexOutOfBoundsException is thrown.

        Returns:
        the int32 value read from the buffer
        Throws:
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - whenever the buffer is too small to read all elements

      • readCompressedInt32

        int readCompressedInt32()

        Reads the content of an int value with 32 bits from the underlying byte-stream buffer. Compared to readInt32() this method reads the 32 bits compressed to the stream, whereas the actual compression depends on the chosen Codec implementation.

        If the underlying buffer is to small to read all of the content, an IndexOutOfBoundsException is thrown.

        Returns:
        the int32 value read from the buffer
        Throws:
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - whenever the buffer is too small to read all elements

      • readInt64

        long readInt64()

        Reads the content of an int value with 64 bits from the underlying byte-stream buffer.

        If the underlying buffer is to small to read all of the content, an IndexOutOfBoundsException is thrown.

        Returns:
        the int64 value read from the buffer
        Throws:
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - whenever the buffer is too small to read all elements

      • readCompressedInt64

        long readCompressedInt64()

        Reads the content of an int value with 64 bits from the underlying byte-stream buffer. Compared to readInt64() this method reads the 64 bits compressed to the stream, whereas the actual compression depends on the chosen Codec implementation.

        If the underlying buffer is to small to read all of the content, an IndexOutOfBoundsException is thrown.

        Returns:
        the int64 value read from the buffer
        Throws:
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - whenever the buffer is too small to read all elements

      • readFloat

        float readFloat()

        Reads the content of a float from the underlying byte-stream buffer.

        If the underlying buffer is to small to read all of the content, an IndexOutOfBoundsException is thrown.

        Returns:
        the float value read from the buffer
        Throws:
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - whenever the buffer is too small to read all elements

      • readDouble

        double readDouble()

        Reads the content of a double from the underlying byte-stream buffer.

        If the underlying buffer is to small to read all of the content, an IndexOutOfBoundsException is thrown.

        Returns:
        the double value read from the buffer
        Throws:
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - whenever the buffer is too small to read all elements

      • readString

        String readString()

        Reads the content of a string from the underlying byte-stream buffer. How the string content was written to the stream depends on the chosen Codec implementation and might offer ASCII and UTF-8 or other options but doesn't have to.

        If the underlying buffer is to small to read all of the content, an IndexOutOfBoundsException is thrown.

        Returns:
        the double value read from the buffer
        Throws:
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - whenever the buffer is too small to read all elements

      • readObject

        <O> O readObject()
          throws Exception

        Reads the content of a non-null object from the underlying byte-stream buffer. The content itself will be deserialized using a registered Marshaller or as an internally handled object type. It is up to the Codec implementation on how to read a type tag for the object inside the data stream.

        If the underlying buffer is to small to read all of the content, an IndexOutOfBoundsException is thrown.

        Type Parameters:
        O - the type of the object to write
        Returns:
        the a non-null object value read from the buffer
        Throws:
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - whenever the buffer is too small to read all elements
        Exception - whenever any other unexpected situation occurs

      • readNullableObject

        <O> O readNullableObject()
                  throws Exception

        Reads the content of a nullable object from the underlying byte-stream buffer. A marker bit is read from the stream to identify the object was null or actual object content is about to follow up. The content itself will be deserialized using a registered Marshaller or as an internally handled object type. It is up to the Codec implementation on how to read a type tag for the object inside the data stream.

        If the underlying buffer is to small to read all of the content, an IndexOutOfBoundsException is thrown.

        Type Parameters:
        O - the type of the object to read
        Returns:
        the an object value read from the buffer or null
        Throws:
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - whenever the buffer is too small to read all elements
        Exception - whenever any other unexpected situation occurs

      • readBytes

        default void readBytes(String fieldName,
                       byte[] bytes)

        Transfers the content of a byte-array from the underlying byte-stream buffer. The byte-array is read as a whole from begin to the end.

        If the underlying buffer is to small to read all of the content, an IndexOutOfBoundsException is thrown.

        The given fieldName is strictly used for debugging purpose. The implementation of the SerializationDebugger might have decided to write the value to the stream but this is not required.

        Parameters:
        bytes - the byte-array to transfer the content to
        fieldName - the name of the field to be read, strictly for debugging purpose only
        Throws:
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - whenever the buffer is too small to read all elements

      • readBytes

        default void readBytes(String fieldName,
                       byte[] bytes,
                       int offset,
                       int length)

        Transfers the content of a byte-array from the underlying byte-stream buffer. The byte-array is read as a whole beginning from the given offset and will be filled with as many bytes as defined by the given length.

        If the underlying buffer is to small to read all of the content, an IndexOutOfBoundsException is thrown.

        The given fieldName is strictly used for debugging purpose. The implementation of the SerializationDebugger might have decided to write the value to the stream but this is not required.

        Parameters:
        bytes - the byte-array to transfer the content to
        offset - the offset to begin to write to
        length - the number of bytes to write
        fieldName - the name of the field to be read, strictly for debugging purpose only
        Throws:
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - whenever the buffer is too small to read all elements

      • readObject

        default <O> O readObject(String fieldName)
                  throws Exception

        Reads the content of a non-null object from the underlying byte-stream buffer. The content itself will be deserialized using a registered Marshaller or as an internally handled object type. It is up to the Codec implementation on how to read a type tag for the object inside the data stream.

        If the underlying buffer is to small to read all of the content, an IndexOutOfBoundsException is thrown.

        The given fieldName is strictly used for debugging purpose. The implementation of the SerializationDebugger might have decided to write the value to the stream but this is not required.

        Type Parameters:
        O - the type of the object to write
        Parameters:
        fieldName - the name of the field to be read, strictly for debugging purpose only
        Returns:
        the a non-null object value read from the buffer
        Throws:
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - whenever the buffer is too small to read all elements
        Exception - whenever any other unexpected situation occurs

      • readNullableObject

        default <O> O readNullableObject(String fieldName)
                          throws Exception

        Reads the content of a nullable object from the underlying byte-stream buffer. A marker bit is read from the stream to identify the object was null or actual object content is about to follow up. The content itself will be deserialized using a registered Marshaller or as an internally handled object type. It is up to the Codec implementation on how to read a type tag for the object inside the data stream.

        If the underlying buffer is to small to read all of the content, an IndexOutOfBoundsException is thrown.

        The given fieldName is strictly used for debugging purpose. The implementation of the SerializationDebugger might have decided to write the value to the stream but this is not required.

        Type Parameters:
        O - the type of the object to read
        Parameters:
        fieldName - the name of the field to be read, strictly for debugging purpose only
        Returns:
        the an object value read from the buffer or null
        Throws:
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - whenever the buffer is too small to read all elements
        Exception - whenever any other unexpected situation occurs

      • getReadableMemoryBuffer

        ReadableMemoryBuffer getReadableMemoryBuffer()
        Returns the internally stored ReadableMemoryBuffer to read raw data directly. This is not recommended and should be avoided whenever possible!
        Returns:
        the wrapped ReadableMemoryBuffer instance
